_header: Ipocras this book made yare / And sente it to the emperor…
Note: Cf. 2687 and 6710; a prose version occurs in Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Dd.10.44, f. 114.
_description: A rhymed preface to an English prose tract on medicine — five couplets

BodAddA106.First Lines:
Ipocras þis buke sent ȝare To þe emperowre
                    cesareWytte þe well þat þis buke is gude leche Wit all
                    thyng it wyll teche…
BodAddA106.Last Lines:
…Man or woman þat haues natHow þai sall be taken in
                    cure

BodLauMis553.First Lines:
Ypocras this boke made ȝareAnd sende to þe
                    Emperour…
BodLauMis553.Last Lines:
…Of eche maner yuel wat hit heas here after sone þou myt
                    seMan oþer womman þat haþ materHe schal be take in to
                    cure

BLHar3383.First Lines: ypocras this boke sent to the emperoure GencianWete þu that this boke ys good lechethe all thynge that hit doeth teche…
BLHar3383.Last Lines: …Nowe thou man take good gemehow þou mayste thy body ȝeme

BLSl2584.First Lines: Ipocras þis book made ȝare& sente it to þe emperor cesare…
BLSl2584.Last Lines: …Man or womman þat materisHe schal ben take in to curie
BLSl2584.Editions:
Pettigrew,  Thomas Joseph. 
             “Observations upon the Extracts from an Ancient English Medical MS. in
                the Royal Library of Stockholm.” 
             Archaeologia
         30 (1844): 419-29: 420-1.

Wellcome405.First Lines:
Þis is þe bok þat ypocras sentTo þe king his
                    newueþ…
Wellcome405.Last Lines:
…Now loke þeron wiþ gode wilEueri man boþe
                    lowde & stille
Wellcome405.Editions:
Keiser,  George R. 
             “Verse Introductions to Middle English Medical Treatises.” 
             English Studies
         84 (2003): 301-17: 312.
